title: Amazing widget!
comment: As others have said this is a MUST coming from iOS for those who are used to having all their notifications automatically display on their lock screen. This is even better than iOS because you can choose what notifications you want and leave out the ones you do not want. EDIT: My only suggestion is to make the ability for more extensions than 10. But it does not keep it from 5 stars. Plus the tiny 4mb RAM usage makes this app almost perfect.

Hi Matthew, I am glad that you like the application. The high RAM usage is only true when you have opened the application selection screen. Creating a list of installed applications takes up some RAM. This is true for any application (for eg. DashClock itself for clock shortcut). The amount the extension really uses is much less, around 5MB.

Hi Hugh, I am glad that you like the application. The high RAM usage is only true when you have opened the application selection screen. Creating a list of installed applications takes up some RAM. comment: I like this extension...but the icons don't match the actual notification.  It is set to use the notification's icon but for some it doesn't....like Google+.  Instead of the g+ icon it shows the icon for Google+ Photos.
Hi Kahil! Thanks for the suggestion. I have added the option to extract icon from notifications. Details can be found here - https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/115585480035899880126

Doesn't work

title: One small request

title: THANK YOU
comment: THIS IS JUST WHAT I NEEDED

title: Turn Screen On Not Working
comment: The "Turn Screen On" feature doesn't work.  Tried it for Kaiten Mail and 8SMS (Messaging) and in either case I hear the vibrate from the app's notification itself, but the screen does not wake up.  When I manually wake it, the notification is there in Dashclock.  Otherwise an excellent addition.

title: Almost perfect
comment: It's very useful and works well but I think that could be awesome if we're able rename what is showed in dashclock's config screen. Would be helpful to identify and reorder. Example: Rename Dashnotifier 10 to Hangout.

title: Great extension
comment: Just what I was looking for - perfect for viewing notifs from many apps on lock screen. Highly customizable too.

title: Vital Comming from iOS
comment: Comming from a iphone to a android phone, having notifications on my lockscreen is vital to me. This app allows you to easily see any notifications that you want from certain apps on your lockscreen. However one annoying feature of this app is that it displays the contents of the first message fine, but the rest it says e.g.  "2 new messages' '3 new messages' I dont understand why it cant show the contents of the rest of the messages..ive even played around with the settings but nothing works. Apart from that, this app is a must have. In the future i would like to be able to dismiss all/certain notifications and also being to reply/delete etc from the lockscreen.

title: Not working right with BBM
comment: It keeps telling me the 'connected' notification instead of the real content of the notification. Please fix this. Thanks.

title: Non-Root Phones! Must Have!!!!!!
comment: Wow!! This app is awesome! :D u made something possible which other apps were only providing with root <3 works awesome with whatsapp fb messenger notifications :D Thank You so Much!!!

title: Now compatible with everything I throw at it.
comment: Had some problems with certain apps in the past but now works with everything I try.
Hi Shaun, v0.46 should fix compatibility with Live Score addicts.

title: 5 Stars
comment: I thought I let my previous comment on Dashclock, not DashNotifier. This app is stupendous.

All the drawing part is taken care of by DashClock. The latest DashClock beta supports font colors. You can get it through this G+ community - https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/113843378176693027087

title: Awesome!!!!
comment: Love the app! Although I would love to have the ability to rename the dashnotifer extensions, that way it will make it easier to identify what app I have set of what dashnotifier #.

title: Superb

title: Privacy
comment: Maybe you could add an option of showing just the name of the sender and not the entire message details.
Hi Dhruv, you can change the extension title format and/or show notification content option to change what information is displayed.

title: Evernote reminders not working
comment: Thanks for bringing DashNotifier to Google play store - a very solid app/most of the apps work ok!However i've been struggling with Evernote reminders:s No matter what i do or try, i just can't get those reminders to show up on my home or lock screen. I've tried to use DashNotifier in both Dashclock and Better Dashclock - no luck:s So is there something i'm missing or should know about?.Thanks in advance:)

title: Latest Fix Worked For Me!
comment: I had set up several apps to alert my through DashNotifier and they were not working.  I contacted the developed and in a couple of days he put out the fix.  It's early, but it seems to be working beautifully!  Thank you for the work and the attention!

title: Solid app

Hi Amol. For music players to work, enable the "Show ongoing notification" option in the extension settings.

title: Help, please.
comment: Everything's fine and dandy, however, when I press a notification and open the app, the notification doesn't dissappear from DashClock. Is it a mistake on my part or is it a bug in this update?
Hi David. The new update should fix the issue you were facing.

title: Good functionality, but buggy on 4.4
comment: Excellent customization options, I really like the option to open straight to the app that the notification is for. However, if I'm using my phone and get a text/email, etc., and read it (meaning that the notification should disappear), when I lock the phone the dismissed notification reappears...

Hi Tim. Try disabling DashNotifier's Accessibility Service (System Settings -> Accessibility -> DashNotifier). The next update will have some kind of a check to make sure that it is not enabled for Android 4.3+.

title: Got prob
comment: There is no icon on apps list so how to initiate it????

Hi Prasanna. The app description does say how to use the application. Detailed instructions:1. Download DashClock (DC) and DashNotifier (DN) 2. Add DC on your lock screen 3. Go to DC settings and add extensions from DN. 4. Go the DN settings screen and choose the options you like. Also available here - http://goo.gl/u3YQKF

title: The best!
comment: The screen on function is the best possible :) It's really handy when your phone is docked!

Hi Mustafa, please send a detailed description of the problem at my email address (through the email developer link below) so that I can assist you further.

title: Heck yeah!

title: Working perfectly

Hi Ahmed. Thank you for the kind words. This app will always be free and there will not be any paid limitations. Donation option may be added in the future.

title: Help
comment: How to use?

Hi Faisal. After you have installed DashNotifier 1. Download DashClock widget 2. Add it on your lock screen 3. Go to DashClock settings and then add extensions from DashNotifier. 4. Go the DashNotifier settings screen and choose the options you like. Hope this helps.

Using the app to show Play Store notifications didn't work so well (some weren't shown) but I haven't tried more. I don't know if DashNotifier affects the battery.

No problem here. I used to use Lightflow to get Dashclock notifications, but this app has completely replaced it for that.   Developer is very responsive and helpful! Can't imagine my device without this now.
Thanks Nick
